page.title: 09F of D Farming
page.content: Approximately a third of the area is covered with{farmland-almost 100% {pasture land.Sheep rearing,stock {raising,a little dairy farming and hay {making}is done.Spring and early summer time sees most activity.Lambs are born in March and ready for market in July. They might be sold in Gloucester or Monmouth markets.Hay making is important and there is some silage making for winter{feed.The farms are {mostly smallholdings passed down {through families-some}don't pay and the owner might have another job.Very few employed in farming.Some people have a quarter to half an acre for keeping horses.One farm is now used as a riding stables and you can hire horses for pony trekking.
